problem.tex: Recall $K(z,z)>0$ on any bounded domain. Thus $\ln K(z,z)$ makes sense. Specifically for the disc, compute \[\frac{d^2}{dzd\overline z}\ln K(z,z).\] Recall that $\frac{d}{dz}=\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{d}{dx}+i\frac{d}{dy}\right)$ and that $\frac{d}{d\overline z}=\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{d}{dx}-i\frac{d}{dy}\right)$.

solution.tex: We computed $K(z,z)$ on the disc to be \[K(z,z)=\frac{1}{\pi\left(1-|z|^2\right)^2}=\frac{1}{\pi}\left(1-z\overline z\right)^{-2}.\] Then \[\ln K(z,z)=-\ln\pi-2\ln(1-z\overline z).\] Taking $\frac{d}{dz}$ of this gives \[2\frac{\overline z}{1-z\overline z}.\] Taking $\frac{d}{d\overline z}$ of this gives \[2\frac{1-z\overline z+z\overline z}{\left(1-z\overline z\right)^2}=\frac{2}{\left(1-|z|^2\right)^2}.\]
